sub_topic: Prove that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_1: What is the power set of the empty set, and how many elements does it contain?
message_2:
The power set of a set is the set of all possible subsets of that set, including the empty set and the set itself. The empty set, denoted as ∅, has no elements. Therefore, the only subset of the empty set is the empty set itself.

So, the power set of the empty set is {∅}, which contains only one element.
